98.body:
@disintegrator Hi :)

It still produces a 300 kB file

It is the way the package is published, using this old typescript format prevents esbuild from tree shaking

https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/tsconfig.json#L9-L10

@kevinsimper ah my bad 🤦 
I missed that it is published as CommonJS. Will flag to switch to dual mode.
@disintegrator awesome, no problem 🙏 thanks for helping

95.body:
Hey thanks for opening this issue.
We don;t support using the files api response as is.
For now, you need to get a signed url for the files

`const signed_url = client.files.getSignedUrl({ fileId: createdFile.id })`

and pass it as an url
`documentUrl: signed_url,`

I will see to add this example to our doc

77.body:
Hey Thomas, thanks for opening an issue. I need more explanations to fully understand it.

I agree about the [model/components/jsonschema.md file](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/3324d3bf417df58b0b58d691d492c0b170a6af90/docs/models/components/jsonschema.md) example not being explicit enough.

That said, I don't get what you mean with "native type of jsonSchema does not bring much information", could explain a bit more? Do you mean in the code ?

One reason for lack of documentation might be that we expect people to directly pass a Zod Object. You can see an example of this [in the examples/src/async_structured_outputs.ts file](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/examples/src/async_structured_outputs.ts#L51-L58).
Okk I understand it better now, thanks ! Which version of the client are you using?
Could you please provide me with the code for your example? I'm curious about what your `ResponseSchema` is.

Ok I think I can guess what is happening there. You're using the `client.chat.complete` function right?

To be able to directly input your Zod Object, please use the `client.chat.parse` function.

@amenasria you are right, I was using `client.chat.complete()`.

Indeed with `.parse()` the `responseFormat` property accepts directly the Zod schema. I lost myself in this, sorry!

No worries, thanks for pointing out that our doc was lacking.

We'll update this in a future release ! 

Closing this issue, feel free to open a new issue if you are still encountering problems !

65.body:
Hi 👋 
Thanks for opening this issue, this is a misconfiguration on our side, we are going to release a fix soon.

64.body: Hey thanks for opening this issue, could you share the full code (or a reproducible snippet)?
This is the full code. The rest is just calling completion endpoint.

52.body: Hi thanks for opening this issue, could you share the code snippet that you used and the version of the sdk?
Sure, i'll update the issue with a repro :)
I have a workaround by adding a custom hook to the HTTPClient, but it's not ideal. I could make a PR to fix this, but the SDK is code gen, so didn't know what the process would be

Thanks for the repro, I will investigate the issue 👀 
> I have a workaround by adding a custom hook to the HTTPClient, but it's not ideal. I could make a PR to fix this, but the SDK is code gen, so didn't know what the process would be

Could you share it? Might help me debug what we are missing 🙇

In fact I think I know the issue -

Basically since 2411 isn't in the map here:
https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/packages/mistralai-gcp/src/sdk/sdk.ts#L19

then [this function ](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/packages/mistralai-gcp/src/sdk/sdk.ts#L25) is just returning `mistral-large`, which is why we get the message

```..."The completion model `mistral-large` does not exist....```

I think the fix might be as simple as:

https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/pull/57

Actually, 2411 is not available using the @ version, but it is available using this format: mistral-large-2411. getModelInfo ensures backward compatibility for old models and should be a no-op for 2411.

I found the issue. For the old format, the version is not passed in the body ("model":"mistral-large") but only in the URL. However, the new format does include it in the body ("model":"mistral-large-2411"). I will fix the code and push a release. 👍
Hum the automation closed the issue, but feel free to re-open it if the bug persist after the new release 🙇
thanks for your help! Do you know roughly when the release will be out?

> Do you know roughly when the release will be out?

The 1.3.5 release includes the fix

39.body:
Hey 👋 
Thanks for reporting this issue could you tell us which version of the SDKs your are using?

36.body:
Hey thanks for reporting the issue. 
Could you provide more info, if possible:
- model name
- queries samples
- time window
So we can look if it correlate with a specific change in our API (if you want to not release those info publicly you can go through our platform help center [here](https://help.mistral.ai/en/))

we're using Large 2507 deployed on Azure. 
I see in your docs that streams are expected to send back `data: 'DONE'` completion events [[here](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/src/models/components/completionchunk.ts#L19)] but again in CompletionResponse that doesn't seem to be accounted for [[here](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/src/models/components/chatcompletionresponse.ts)]
Maybe could there at least be some callback handlers added in the code e.g. onError etc so we can handle the ZOD error the code throws a bit better?

34.body:
Hello,
The training parameters is not being ignored, sorry for the confusion. You can check the full job via the api, basically if you specify training_parameters it will be converted into epochs. For this example 10 training steps corresponds to 231 epochs. 

You can also just specify epochs and you will be able to see via the API how many training steps it corresponds to. 

Thank you!

32.body:
Hey 👋

Would you mind sharing a code snippet of what you are looking to do? To make sure we fully understand 👍

Currently (with the latest version), you can import the types with:
```typescript
import { ChatCompletionResponse } from "@mistralai/mistralai/models/components";
```
A full example can be found [here](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/docs/models/components/chatcompletionresponse.md).

Would this work for you?

30.body:
> Thanks for reporting the issue, we will investigate the issue. In the meantime, you can use the following syntax:
> 
> ```ts
> const chatResponse = await client.chat.complete({
>   model: "pixtral-12b",
>   messages: [
>     {
>       role: "user",
>       content: [
>         { type: "text", text: "What's in this image?" },
>         {
>           type: "image_url",
>           imageUrl: "https://mistral.ai/images/news/codestral/FIM_table.png",
>         },
>       ]
>     }
>   ],
> });
> ```

Thanks!

After some investigation, to make it works with the original syntax you should use:
```typescript
 {
  "type": "image_url",
  "imageUrl": "https://tripfixers.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/eiffel-tower-with-snow.jpeg"
 }
 ```
 `image_url` -> `imageUrl`
 We are updating the doc to use the syntax I shared with you in https://github.com/mistralai/platform-docs-public/pull/138 and we added an example as well in https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/pull/31
 
 Let us know if you have more questions 🚀
